fields.name: 2012 Survey for Agencies
fields.description:
Please note before submitting data

Please complete a separate survey tool for each of the participating countries in which you are supporting health sector development. For instance, where you are providing health sector aid (directly or indirectly). Health sector aid is defined as: “ODA contributed to the health sector.” Our system should be clever enough to only give you the option to select the countries in which you are supporting the health sector, but please get in touch with your IHP+Results focal point if this is not the case.

Data is requested for calendar years, not fiscal years.

  • You should enter financial data in the most appropriate currency. Please select your currency from the drop-down list at the top of the survey.
  • Please provide source information – ideally weblinks or references to published documents – in the ‘Voluntary additional information’ text boxes.

In addition to the guidance above we advise you to have a copy of the [Overview Guidance] to hand when you begin submitting your data as it is possible that this will cover any questions you may have. Alternatively please get in touch with your IHP+Results focal point.

fields.name: 2012 Survey for Governments
fields.description:
Please note before submitting data

  • Data is requested for calendar years (not fiscal years).
  • Our preference is for 2011 data for latest year, but if this is not available we can accept 2010 data. You will be prompted at the top of the survey to indicate which years you are providing data for (both baseline and latest years). Please then provide data for these respective years for every question.
  • You should enter financial data in the most appropriate currency. Please select your currency from the drop-down list at the top of the survey.
  • If you are responding from one of the ten countries that participated in IHP+Results 2010 monitoring, you only need to provide latest year data (2010 or 2011) as you have previously reported baseline data. If you are responding from one of the nine countries participating for the first time, you need to submit baseline data too (2005, 2006 or 2007).
  • Please provide source information – ideally weblinks or references to published documents – in the ‘Voluntary additional information’ text boxes.

In addition to the guidance above we advise you to have a copy of the Overview Guidance to hand when you begin submitting your data as it is possible that this will cover any questions you may have. Alternatively please get in touch with your IHP+Results focal point.
